- $\answer{1000}$
- Calculating the values of $\log_2 N$ and $\log_2(C-1000)$, we get
  ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/cb0acab8-5dc0-4da0-b2ae-e9c280e0b35f/images/a4a0598f-1773-4143-b4c0-43fa3acec483/6ed34dc57af21ba83ab1d7783038566a019696c0.svg)


  Hence, if we draw a scatter diagram of $\log_2(C-1000)$ versus
$\log_2 N$, we have
  ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/cb0acab8-5dc0-4da0-b2ae-e9c280e0b35f/images/ba1b960b-af66-4648-8cd3-21a512c38b91/ac6a60df9e23d37ccee604e1315d7e96fdca9f98.svg)


- $\answer{\text{Linear model}}$
- $\answer{\log_2(C-1000) = 0.853\log_2 N + 3.02}$ [$\text{by using G.D.C.}$]
- Using the properties of logarithms, we have

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{3.5em} \log_2(C-1000) &= 0.853\log_2 N + 3.02 \\[6pt]
  \log_2(C-1000) &= \log_2 N^{0.853} + \log_2 2^{3.02} \\[6pt]
  \log_2(C-1000) &= \log_2 (8.11N^{0.853}) \hspace{3em} [2^{3.02} \approx 8.11] \\[6pt]
  C - 1000 &= 8.11N^{0.853} \\[6pt]
  C &= 8.11N^{0.853} + 1000\end{aligned}
  $$

  Hence we find
$\answer{a = 8.11}$
and  $\answer{b = 0.853}$
- Evaluating $C$ when $N = 800$, we obtain

  $$
  \begin{aligned}
  \hspace{2.6em} C &= 8.11(800)^{0.853} + 1000 \\[6pt]
  &\answer{\approx 3430 \text{ EUR}}\end{aligned}
  $$

- $\answer{\text{Not valid, \(N = 800\) is not within the range of the given data}}$
- 
  - We have

    $$
    \begin{aligned}
    C &= aN^b + 1000 \hspace{0.5em} \\[6pt]
    C - 1000 &= aN^b \end{aligned}
    $$

    Hence
$\answer{\text{the values of \(C - 1000\) versus \(N\)}}$
must entered into G.D.C.
    to determine Sandra's equation using power regression method.
  - Calculating the values of $C-1000$, we have
    ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/cb0acab8-5dc0-4da0-b2ae-e9c280e0b35f/images/84db4808-3293-4034-9822-257357cdc091/35ba533211e955abab6f16c3be55a978b4acd112.svg)


    Entering the data above into G.D.C. as described in part (h)
(i), we get

    $$
    \begin{aligned}
    \hspace{10.1em} C - 1000 &= 7.56N^{0.866} \hspace{2em} [\text{by power regression}]\\[6pt]
    C &= 7.56N^{0.866} + 1000\end{aligned}
    $$

    Hence we find
$\answer{a = 7.56}$
and
$\answer{b = 0.866}$
as expected.

list.title: Question 112
list.content: John is investigating a relationship between two sets of data, $X$ and $Y$. After creating a scatter plot with $\ln Y$ on the $y$-axis and $\ln X$ on the $x$-axis, John notices what appears to be a strong negative linear correlation. The line of best fit passes through the points $(1,3.6)$ and $(6,1.6)$, as shown in the following diagram. ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/ef7542bf-9af6-4711-830a-7d31be18c041/images/4453a3d6-68cd-41c3-9c57-b3b81ac9d601/ai1063.PNG) - Find an equation for $Y$ in terms of $X$.[4] John also has some data relating the same variable $Y$, with another variable $Z$. He thinks the data can be modelled by $\log_{10}Y = m\log_{10}Z + c$. Upon investigation, John does find a linear relationship between $\log_{10}Y$ and $\log_{10}Z$, with $m=0.6$ and $c=0.2$. - Find an equation for $X$ in terms of $Z$.[4]
list.markScheme:
- First, we form an equation of the form $\ln Y = m\ln X + c$, where $m$ is the gradient and $c$ is the $y$-intercept. For the gradient, we have

  $$
  \begin{align*}
  m &= \dfrac{y_2 - y_1}{x_2 - x_1} \\[8pt]
  &= \dfrac{1.6 - 3.6}{6 - 1} \\[8pt]
  m &= -0.4
  \end{align*}
  $$

  Using the formula for the equation of a straight line, we have

  $$
  \begin{align*}
  y - y_1 &= m(x - x_1) \\[8pt]
  \ln Y - 3.6 &= -0.4(\ln X - 1) \\[8pt]
  \ln Y &= -0.4\ln X + 4
  \end{align*}
  $$

  Now we make $Y$ the subject of the equation:

  $$
  \begin{align*}
  \ln Y &= \ln X^{-0.4} + 4 \hspace{3em}[a\ln b = \ln b^a]\\[8pt]
  Y &= e^{\ln X^{-0.4} + 4} \\[8pt]
  &= X^{-0.4} \cdot e^4 \hspace{3em}[a^{m+n} = a^m \cdot a^n] \\[8pt]
  &\hspace{-0.7em}\tcbhighmath{Y = 54.6\,X^{-0.4}}
  \end{align*}
  $$

- We have $\log_{10}Y = 0.6\log_{10}Z + 0.2$. Therefore,

  $$
  \begin{align*}
  \log_{10}Y &= \log_{10}Z^{0.6} + 0.2 \\[8pt]
  Y &= 10^{\log_{10}Z^{0.6} + 0.2} \\[8pt]
  Y &= 1.585\,Z^{0.6}
  \end{align*}
  $$

  From part (a) we have $Y = 54.6\,X^{-0.4}$. Hence, equating the right hand side of each equation,

  $$
  \begin{align*}
  1.585\,Z^{0.6} &= 54.6\,X^{-0.4} \\[8pt]
  1.585\,Z^{0.6} &= \dfrac{54.6}{X^{0.4}} \\[8pt]
  X^{0.4} &= \dfrac{54.6}{1.585\,Z^{0.6}} \\[8pt]
  &= 34.45\,Z^{-0.6} \\[8pt]
  \left(X^{0.4}\right)^{2.5} &= \left(34.45\,Z^{-0.6}\right)^{2.5} \\[8pt]
  &\hspace{-0.7em}\tcbhighmath{X = 6970\,Z^{-1.5}}
  \end{align*}
  $$

list.title: Question 113
list.content: This question is about several regression equations and differential equations that can be used to model the number of views of a popular video published by a celebrity. The following table shows the number of views $V$, in millions, of an internet celebrity has on her video channel $t$ hours after her last video was released. ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/1f55c8eb-5664-4bcc-9237-78899795d3f9/images/501de319-17db-4078-88bd-375e001df7a0/1046a.PNG) The data is also shown on the following scatter diagram: ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/1f55c8eb-5664-4bcc-9237-78899795d3f9/images/8c5ffe2d-9c13-431f-8151-883d37edccf0/1046b.PNG) - - Find the equation of the regression line $V(t)$ on $t$. - Sketch the regression line on the scatter diagram above. - Find the Pearson's product-moment correlation coefficient, $r$. - Explain why it is not appropriate to conduct a hypothesis test on the value found in (a) (iii). [5] A proposed model for approximating the first few hours since the video was released is given by the differential equation $V'(t) = \beta V(t)$, where $\beta$ is a constant related to the impact of the videos published by the celebrity. - - Find the general solution to this differential equation. - Using the given data, write down the equation of the non-linear regression model suggested by part (b) (i). - Sketch this curve on the scatter diagram. - For this model, write down the value of $R^2$. - Comment on the suitability of this model. [9] A third model proposed is a logarithmic regression. - - Write down the equation of the logarithmic regression model. - Sketch this curve on the scatter diagram. - State one limitation of the logarithmic model in approximating the number of views in the first few hours after a video is released. [4] An estimate for $V'(t)$, $t\geq 3$, can be found using the formula $$ \begin{align*} V'(t) \approx \dfrac{V(t+3)-V(t-3)}{6} \end{align*} $$ The following table shows some estimates of $V'(t)$ according to the formula. ![SkillUpp Image](https://assets.revisionvillage.com/public/question/1f55c8eb-5664-4bcc-9237-78899795d3f9/images/9e9d502d-32b4-422c-bfdf-23c7cc14c515/1046c.PNG) - Find the values of $p$ and $q$. Give your answer correct to one decimal place. [3] An improved model for $V$ capable of dealing with high values of $t$ is given by the differential equation $$ \begin{align*} \dfrac{V'(t)}{V(t)} = k - \dfrac{k}{L}V(t) \end{align*} $$ According to this model, the quotient $\dfrac{V'(t)}{V(t)}$ is a linear function of $V(t)$. - - Use linear regression to find the value of $L$ rounded to the nearest thousand. - Given that the solution to the differential equation is $V(t)=\dfrac{L}{1+Ce^{-kt}}$, where $k>0$, estimate the number of views the video will have over a long period of time. [7]
